Taxon name.Name: Pachysolen tannophilus
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Pachysolen tannophilus Boidin & Adzet 1957 MB#302177 
Taxonomic synonyms: 
   - Pachysolen pelliculatus Boidin & Adzet 1957 MB#302176 
   - Hansenula tannophila (Boidin & Azet) Campbell 1973 MB#314880

Other culture collection numbers: ATCC 32691; CBS 4044; CCRC 20329; DBVPG 6666; IMI 344640; MUCL 31901; NCYC 614; NRRL Y-2460; VTT C-81121
Restrictions on use: for commercial development a special agreement is requested
Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: no known restrictions under the Nagoya protocol
History: IHEM, 1991 < CCRC < W.H. Hsu < NRRL < J. Boidin
Applications: production of: ethanol from D-xylose (Biotechnol. Lett. 3: 89-92 and 415-420, 1981; Biotechnol. Bioeng. 24: 371-384, 1982; U.S. Pats. 4,359,534 and 4,663,284), ethanol from D-galactose and glycerol (Enzyme Microb. Technol. 4 : 349-352, 1982), ethanol (Bio/ Technology 3: 59-62, 1985), NADPH-linked D-xylose reductase and NAD-linked xylitol dehydrogenase (Biotechnol. Bioeng. 27: 302-307, 1985), xylitol dehydrogenase (FEMS Microbiol. Lett. 25: 195-198, 1984), alcohol dehydrogenase and xylitol dehydrogenase (Appl. Microbiol.  Biotechnol. 26: 231-233,1987), aldose reductase and xylitol dehydrogenase (Appl. Environ. Microbiol. 52: 660-664, 1986), riboflavin (World J. Microbiol. Biotechnol. 8: 190-191, 1992); conversion of wheat straw cellulose/hemicellulose to ethanol (ibid., 24: 1105-1113, 1982) and of D-xylose to ethanol (Adv. Biochem. Eng. Biotechnol. 27: 73-83, 1983)
